cards.name: Mirage Stadium
text: Whenever a player tries to Retreat a Pokémon during his or her turn, that player flips a coin. If heads, that player retreats that Pokémon (and discards Energy normally). If tails, that Pokémon can't Retreat this turn (the player doesn't discard any Energy).

ability.name: Venom Spray
ability.text: When you play Beedrill from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Needle Rush
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. If you get 1 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If you get 2 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If you get 3 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage. If you get 4 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Freeze Lock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Active Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Crushing Ice
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost. Damage is calculated using the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost after applying effects to the Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Miracle Sphere Beta
text: If the Pokémon using this attack has and basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If the Pokémon using this attack has and basic Energy cards attached to it, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any, and your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

ability.name: Manipulate
ability.text: When you play Gengar from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may put a Basic Pokémon (excluding Baby Pokémon) from your discard pile onto your bench. Then flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydrokinesis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Primal Aura
ability.text: As long as Kabutops is your Active Pokémon, neither player can play Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Fire Stream
attacks.text: Discard a Energy card attached to Magcargo in order to use this attack. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Pure Body
ability.text: To attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Raikou, you must discard an Energy card attached to Raikou. (Attach the Lightning energy, and then discard an Energy card from Raikou.)

attacks.name: Lightning Sphere
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Energy cards attached to Raikou. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Bounce Off
attacks.text: If Magneton and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards attached to them, the player controlling the Active Pokémon with the fewest number of Energy cards attached to it switches 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magnetic Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon minus the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (For example, if your opponent has 1 Benched Pokémon and you have 3, this attack will do 30 damage plus 20 more damage.)

ability.name: Evolution Helper
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack) if Nidoqueen is on your bench, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from your Active Pokémon and attach it to your Active Pokémon. (this counts as evolving that Pokémon) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Claw
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Miracle Sphere Gamma
text: If the Pokémon using this attack has and basic Energy cards attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If the Pokémon using this attack has and basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage and lets you put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sudden Growth
attacks.text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to Politoed.

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Splash
attacks.text: Move 2 Energy cards attached to Politoed to 1 or 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You may put both on the same Pokémon, or 1 each on 2 different Pokémon.) If you have no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each Pokémon with a Poké

attacks.name: Lightning Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on Raichu.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to Starmie and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Star Back
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Water of Evolution
attacks.text: Put an Omastar from your hand onto Omanyte. This counts as evolving Omanyte.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Sharp Stinger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Psychoflow

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put a damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Eerie Light

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution

cards.name: Mystery Plate Alpha
text: If your opponent has 5 or more Prizes, search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If your opponent has only 1 Prize, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.text: If your opponent has nay Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poisonous Saliva
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

text: If your opponent has 5 or more Prizes, draw 3 cards. If your opponent has only 1 Prize, choose 2 Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon (1 if it has only 1). Your opponent shuffles those cards into his or her deck.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Relic Hunter
text: Search your deck for up to 2 Supporter and/or Stadium cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Crystal Shard
text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon's type (color) is . If that Pokémon attacks, discard this card at the end of the turn.

cards.name: Desert Shaman
text: Shuffle your hand into your deck and draw up to 4 cards. You opponent does the same.

cards.name: Fast Ball
text: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal an Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards into your deck. (If you don't reveal an Evolution card, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)

cards.name: Friend Ball
text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Search your deck for a Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, of Evolution card of the same type (color), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Lure Ball
text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose an Evolution card from your discard pile, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Oracle
text: Choose 2 cards from your deck and shuffle the rest of your deck. Put the chosen cards in top of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Underground Expedition
text: Look at the bottom 4 cards if your deck. Put 2 of those cards into your hand, and then return the remaining cards to the bottom of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Bounce Energy
text: This card provides Energy. You can attach this card to your Pokémon that has basic Energy cards attached to it. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon, return a basic Energy card attached to that Pokémon to your hand.

cards.name: Cyclone Energy
text: This card provides Energy. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to your Active Pokémon, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Retro Energy
text: This card provides Energy. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to 1 of your Evolved Pokémon, you may remove up to 2 damage counters from that Pokémon and discard the top card from it. (This counts as devolving it.)

ability.name: Energy Jump

cards.name: Ancient Ruins

cards.name: Hyper Potion
text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Discard 1 or 2 basic Energy cards attached to that Pokémon. If you discarded 1 Energy card, remove up to 3 damage counters from that Pokémon. If you discarded 2 Energy cards, remove up to 5 damage counters from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Star Piece
text: At any time between turns, if the Pokémon this card is attached to is Benched and has 2 or more damage counters in it, search your deck for an Evolution card that Pokémon evolves into and put it on top of that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, discard Star Piece.
